snippet: Members of President Obama’s national security team took the case for intervention before the House Foreign Affairs Committee on Wednesday, a day after appearing before the panel’s Senate counterpart.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and THOM SHANKER

lead_paragraph: Members of President Obama’s national security team took the case for intervention before the House Foreign Affairs Committee on Wednesday, a day after appearing before the panel’s Senate counterpart.

headline.main: In Hearing, House Panel Seems Split on Syria Strike
